content: inspired by classic quilting patterns the carpenter or woven star is a timeless heritage pattern with surprisingly simple stitches this square blanket is knit in garter stitch in square pieces great for on the go each square is worked corner to corner with increases and decreases no stranded color work there are two colorways the alternating colors is striking with only 3 colors the rainbow shift colorway was inspired as a celebration of rainbow babies and employs 9 colors although there are more colors the technique is just as simple babies will love the high contrast of either colorway gauge is not crucial to this pattern
